column1: Narrator : The boat arrives on a tiny island, its beach riddled with boat carcasses of all size and shapes. There’s an old cabin a the end of the beach.

column2: OtherSpeak : I'm a master carpenter, I can make your boat better if you want!

column3: Choice : Take a look at my NOMBATEAU! (trade)
column9: Choice : Let's go back to serious matters.
column12: Choice : How’s the carpenter life going? (quest)
column14: Choice : What’s going on around the island ?

column4: OtherSpeak : After threatening me? No way.
column10: OtherSpeak : Go DIRECTIONTOFORMULA, you’ll hear about it, for sure!
column11: OtherSpeak : Nope, never heard about it!
column15: OtherSpeak : Can’t talk… Too many boats to fix.

column5: OtherSpeak : Take this and leave this island!
column12: OtherSpeak : I don’t have time to sail myself anymore.

column5: OtherSpeak : It’s all I have left...

column1: Narrator : The carpenter lays dead in front of his house, and the door is wide open behind him.
PlayerSpeak : Just a stack of straw…

column3: Narrator : There’s a small hay bed to sleep on, and a pantry near the door.
column6: Narrator : There’s a small hay bed to sleep on, and a barrel filled with weapons.
column9: Narrator : There’s a thin straw mattress on the floor to sleep on, and a chest filled with random stuff.
